alert.note: Alert for Great Salt Lake Desert and Mountains; Northern Wasatch Front; Salt Lake Valley; Tooele and Rush Valleys; Utah Valley; Wasatch Back; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Western Millard and Juab Counties; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 10 at 5:52PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Weber... northeastern Juab...northwestern Wasatch...Salt Lake...eastern Davis...Morgan...western Summit...northwestern Utah and east central Tooele Counties through 645 PM MST... At 550 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles northeast of Morgan to 7 miles east of Skull Valley. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Salt Lake City, West Valley City, Provo, Sandy, Layton, Murray, Bountiful, Tooele, Farmington, Grantsville, Park City, Morgan, Coalville, Heber City, West Jordan, Orem, Taylorsville, South Jordan, Lehi and Draper. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 268 and 331. Interstate 84 between mile markers 90 and 119. Interstate 80 in Utah between mile markers 83 and 179. US Route 40 between mile markers 0 and 20. Utah Route 35 between mile markers 0 and 4. Mirror Lake Highway between mile markers 0 and 8, and between mile markers 41 and 42. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
